sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 4} and B = {2, 4, 6}. Compute (A x B) ∩ (B x A) and show that it is not equal to (B x A) ∩ (A x B), hence proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
